hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'The prayer of a group is superior to the prayer of a single person by twenty-seven degrees.'

narrators.name: Malik
narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani

Topics: Superiority of congregational prayer over individual prayer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'The congregational prayer is better than the prayer of one of you alone by twenty-five portions.'

narrators.name: Malik
narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani

chainIssues: Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri is classified as mudallis but uses 'an (عَنْ) transmission. However, he is generally considered reliable by majority of scholars, particularly in transmissions from Sa'id ibn al-Musayyab
Incomplete collector/first narrator - sanad begins with 'wa-haddathani' (and he narrated to me) without naming the direct narrator

potential_issues.impact: The chain begins with 'wa-haddathani' (and he narrated to me) without identification of the direct narrator from Malik. This creates a gap in the chain.

Al-Zuhri is classified as a mudallis (concealer of chain discontinuity) of category 2 by some scholars. However, his transmission from Sa'id ibn al-Musayyab is well-established and he is generally considered reliable. This does not significantly affect authenticity as al-Zuhri is a prominent reliable scholar whose transmissions are widely accepted.

Topics: Superiority of congregational prayer over solitary prayer
Merits of praying with the congregation

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'By the One in Whose hand is my soul! I have thought to command that firewood be gathered, then I would command for prayer to be announced, then I would command a man to lead the people in prayer, then I would go to men's houses and burn them upon them. By the One in Whose hand is my soul! If only one of them knew that he would find a fat bone or two good morsels, he would attend the evening prayer.'

narrators.name: Malik
narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani

narrators.name: Abu al-Zinad

Topics: Incident of the Prophet's ﷺ stern warning about those absent from congregational prayer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Abdullah: We were with the Prophet ﷺ in the marketplace, and he said, 'O assembly of people! Indeed, I am the messenger of Allah to all of you.' A man said, 'O messenger of Allah, are you from the Quraysh?' He said, 'Yes, I am from the Quraysh, from Bani Hashim.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Zayd ibn Thabit: The Prophet ﷺ came to the mosque, and there was a person praying alone. He said, 'Who will help this man in his prayer?' Meaning, who will pray with him to complete his congregation.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Sumayya: The Prophet ﷺ said to Umar, 'Come on! You are needed!' Umar asked, 'For what am I needed, O Messenger of Allah?' He said, 'For bearing witness to my prophethood.'

narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani

Sumayya's reliability status is unknown (majhul al-hal). While she appears as a companion, her transmission reliability is not well-established, affecting the overall strength of the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Uthman is Saduq (trustworthy but with some issues)
potential_issues.impact: Abdullah ibn Uthman is graded as Saduq, indicating he is generally reliable but may have some minor unreliability. This contributes to a weakening of the chain compared to higher-graded narrators.

Topics: Dialogue between the Prophet ﷺ and Umar regarding witnessing prophethood

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: While a man was walking on a path, he found a thorn branch on the path and removed it. Allah appreciated his action and forgave him.

hadiths.english_translation: He said: 'There are five types of martyrs: the plague-stricken, the one afflicted with cholera, the drowned, the one crushed by a collapsing building, and the one killed in the way of Allah.'

chainIssues: Complete disconnection - No chain of transmission provided
The statement 'wa-qala' (and he said) is a continuation without identifying speaker or source
This hadith appears to be disconnected (maqtu') - missing complete chain from original source

potential_issues.impact: The hadith has no proper chain of transmission. It is presented as a continuation ('wa-qala' - and he said) without identifying who is speaking or the source of the statement. This makes it severely disconnected and unreliable.
Without any identified narrators, we cannot assess the reliability of the transmission.

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Types of martyrs according to Islamic teachings
Martyrdom in the path of Allah

hadiths.english_translation: He said: 'If people knew what is in the call to prayer and the first row, then they found no other way except to draw lots, they would draw lots for it. And if they knew what is in early arrival, they would race to it. And if they knew what is in the evening prayer and the dawn prayer, they would attend them even if crawling.'

chainIssues: Complete disconnection - No chain of transmission provided
The statement 'wa-qala' (and he said) is a continuation without identifying speaker or source
This hadith appears to be disconnected (maqtu') - missing complete chain from original source

potential_issues.impact: The hadith has no proper chain of transmission. It is presented as a continuation ('wa-qala' - and he said) without identifying who is speaking or the source of the statement. This makes it severely disconnected and unreliable.
Without any identified narrators, we cannot assess the reliability of the transmission.

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Merits of the call to prayer (Adhan)
Merits of the first row in prayer
Importance of early arrival to prayer
Merits of evening and dawn prayers
Encouragement to attend prayer at any cost

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Bakr ibn Sulayman ibn Abi Haththamah: Umar ibn al-Khattab missed Sulayman ibn Abi Haththamah at the dawn prayer. Umar went to the market early, and Sulayman's residence was between the market and the Prophet's Mosque. He passed by al-Shifaa', Sulayman's mother, and said to her: 'I did not see Sulayman at dawn.' She said: 'He spent the night praying and sleep overcame his eyes.' Umar said: 'For me to witness the dawn prayer in congregation is more beloved to me than standing all night.'

narrators.name: Malik
narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani

narrators.name: Ibn Shihab
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Sulayman ibn Abi Haththamah
narrators.full_name: Abu Bakr ibn Sulayman ibn Abi Haththamah al-Ansari

chainIssues: Incomplete collector/first narrator - sanad begins with 'wa-haddathani' (and he narrated to me) without naming the direct narrator
Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri is classified as mudallis but uses 'an transmission

potential_issues.impact: The chain begins with 'wa-haddathani' (and he narrated to me) without identification of the direct narrator from Malik.

Al-Zuhri is classified as a mudallis (concealer of chain discontinuity) of category 2. However, his transmission is generally accepted, and he is considered reliable. This does not significantly affect authenticity.

potential_issues.issue: Hadith is mawquf (stopped at companion), not marfu'
potential_issues.impact: The statement is attributed to Umar ibn al-Khattab, not the Prophet ﷺ. It is a companion's statement (mawquf) rather than a prophetic tradition (marfu').

Topics: Incident of Umar ibn al-Khattab missing congregational dawn prayer
Sulayman ibn Abi Haththamah spending the night in prayer
Umar's statement on the merit of congregational dawn prayer over voluntary night prayer
Preference of congregational prayer over individual worship

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Amrah al-Ansari: Uthman ibn Affan came to the evening prayer and saw few people in the mosque, so he lay down at the back of the mosque waiting for the people to increase. Ibn Abi Amrah came to him and sat with him and asked him who he was. He told him. He asked: 'What Quran do you have?' He told him. Uthman said to him: 'Whoever attends the evening prayer is as if he has stood for half the night, and whoever attends the dawn prayer is as if he has stood the whole night.'

narrators.name: Malik
narrators.full_name: Malik ibn Anas ibn Malik ibn Abi Amir al-Asbahi al-Madani
